page.title: 13BLACK CHAPEL.
page.content: {Black Chapel}is in North End. It was built about 1300 as a chapel connected to{Leez Priory.}Two monks lived in the house and worked there. They wore black robes which is why it was called Black Chapel. It is a free church and is used for services, Sunday school and christenings, but cannot be used for weddings. In World War 2 it was damaged by a bomb but it has been repaired now. The walls are timber framed and filled with wattle and daub.There is an old organ up on the balcony. The pews are wooden and some have doors and are like little rooms Two old people still live in the house and they look after the church.
